content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a solution in Julia programming language:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks in the markdown document
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=RegexSeed()))
    
    # Join the code blocks together with newline
    joined_code = join([block.captures[1] for block in blocks], "\n")
    
    return joined_code
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all Julia language code blocks in the markdown document and then concatenates them together. Note that it assumes that each code block is separated by two newline characters (`\n\n`). If your markdown format is different, you might need to adjust this function accordingly.
